The couple that runs the place are the friendliest most hard-working peeps you'll ever witness.  The sushi is yummy especially for the ease and price.  Everything is take out.
author: Amanda N.

description: This is 3 stars in terms of a cheap, quick, tastey lunch. Not 4 stars in comparison to a fabulous restaurant out and about--but if fast and yummy is what you're looking for, this will hit the spot. It's around the corner from my office, so that's another good thing for me. Both the soba and udon are really good, and the sushi rolls aren't bad. You can walk out with soup and rolls for under $5--that works for me!
author: michaela w.

description: five stars because where else can you find your meal for under five bucks in the financial district thats good fast and hot. The only problem was it was closed last week when it was sooo cold. I always get the full size udon with tempura batter and kitsune. They also have a bottle of spices that I always spill into my soup to make it hot and spicy. mmmmm
author: dI c.

description:
thanks yelp for making me discover this place!!!

so much for such little money!
not only is the food here wonderful, the people running this place are uber-sweet!!
i had ordered a teriyaki chicken (the half portion was just right for me) and just as i was finishing my meal, the mama of the restaurant actually offered me hot, yummy soup!!! the wakame soup was sooooo hot and flavorful that it really made my day - along with of course her warm hospitality!!

the place seems to be frequented mostly by old timers. they remember most peoples' staple orders and even greet people walking outside if they know them....havent seen too many of such warm & friendly people of late :)

bought myself some pocky and sembe - reminded me of my good ol' days in japan when i'd munch on these in my afternoon breaks at work! :P

in any case, am sure to go back to check out the super popular udon and soba!
author: Shradha B.

description:
it's really easy to walk by this place as there are no signs outside the door, just a decal on the window that says "Yo Yo's".  at least once a week i get a half order of udon with everything.  on a cold day like this, it's the best treat in the whole wide world, maybe except for free range on a box of chocolate truffles.  they also have premade sushi for purchase on the side, wasabi peas, edemame, etc.  

the only employees there are this really happy older couple.  the wife is preparing the food, and the husband rings you up.

once my udon is brought to the counter, he opens the lid so i can take this beautiful oversized squeeze bottle of spicy pepper and pour those little happy love nuggets into my soup.  hells yes.

and i'll walk out only spending 2.50.  in the fidi hood of 10 dollar salads or 6 dollar thimble-sized sf soup company concotions, that's *insane*.
author: Shelley D.

description: Loved my noodle bowl and the sushi was a good side dish.  Such a great meal for the price.  Fast service.
author: Stephanie B.

description: On those days when you want something light, and don't want to spend too much, Yo Yo's has got your back. Menu's really small, as others have mentioned, but it's not bad. Well worth 2-5 dollars. Watch out for the soup /noodles if MSG is a no no for you.
author: Terence T.

description:
Yo Yo's is a hidden gem for those looking for cheap eats in SF.  Although not every item on the menu is a home run, several items they offer are off the chain.  

1.  The soup:  Great slurping noodles, delicious broth, weird little snacky things, a little sea weed, and some ground chilly pepper you can add your self.  Large is a meal in itself, and can be purchased with change you found in your couch and between your car seats.

2.  The squid salad:  It is the orange looking dish served in tupperware right on the counter.  I get it every time.  It is so good.  Chewy, vinegary, mmmm yes.  Cheap as it gets.

3  Seaweed salad:  Standard stuff.  Very good.

4.  Don't miss out on the sweet rice things that are wrapped in a sweet tan colored wrapping thing.  I wish I had a better way to describe them, or even knew what they are called.  Buy them.  $1.50 . . Cheaper than a cookie, and better for you.

Go to Yo Yo's!  Very good food for the price, and the two people running the shop could not be sweeter if they were on T.V.
author: will h.

description: Yo Yo's is the perfect "utility" sushi place...Sure you can probably get better sushi elsewhere, but not at this price. The owners are super friendly & the sushi chef is a freakin' riot. Watch for unique sushi creations like the "burrito roll" (it comes wrapped in tin foil just like a burrito...brilliant!).
author: Casey R.

description: Completely disagree that it's as good as it gets, but I'm definitely a fan. On days when I'm trying to eat healthy, I can grab edamame, wakame salad, and some fruit for under $5. The line moves quickly and Mr. and Mrs. Yoyo always brighten my day. Perfect place for something quick and cheap.
author: Maria B.

description: The owners know my order: half soba with everything.  If I'm really hungry, I'll add a 6-pc sushi roll.  Or have a half-order chicken teriyaki.  Yum.  They're also open in the morning if you want something for breakfast.
author: Boba F.

description:
I used to come here a lot, since changing jobs haven't gone as often.  It's still pretty tasty, but the portions are smaller AND more expensive. WTF?  Hitting the customer on both ends??!!   They've started using new packaging, maybe that's what's driving the price up.  It's still very affordable, and the Udon is awesome. I really like the wheat noodle, can't remember what that's called - Soba I think it is.  Extra tofu cake. yummy.  
Rolls are ok, nothing special.
author: Laura H.

description: One udon/soba, everything, double bean curd.  Been coming here for a few months on a regular basis, sometimes even 2-3 times a week and the lady behind the counter knows what i want now...was kind of funny one time this guy who kind of looked like a homeless guy walked in and started talking about things randomly and got some free food after like 5 minutes.
author: kenny w.

description: The only reason you won't walk right by Yo Yo's without noticing it is because you have to consciously avoid the line coming out the door to pass. Take this as a good sign. The place is barely a walk-in closet, but you'll be in and out in two minutes tops. Be prepared to tell the smiling woman in back what you want, she'll ask. You're having full udon (or just half if you're not too hungry) with everything. When the nice man at the cash register asks "spicy?", pour a couple thumbnails-worth in there -- spicy goes a long way. Pay him $2.25 and get back to work, your boss is waiting.
author: Marty S.

description: "Hellooo" in a sweet voice, "good to see you again". Husband and wife owned and operated, So friendly. Great simple Udon
author: Brandon D.

description:
I do love coming here, especially when I only want to spend $5 on lunch! The couple that run the place is adorable! Very nice and friendly and the wife  always remembers everybody. I've had the udon, soba, and the teriyaki and the noodles are my favorite. 

The taco truck across the street is really good, too!!!!!
author: R R.

description: Cheap food, friendly service. This wasn't the best California roll I've ever had, but it will do for the price and the convenient location.
author: CC M.

description: Amazing couple run the place like a swiss watch.  Fantastic needles served up hot and fast and cheap.  Definitely my most regularly hit lunch spot in SF.
author: Tory P.

description: Small mom and pop shop where you feel great in supporting the business. The two owners double team the restaurant and are genuinely siked to serve you. While the sushi quality isn't the best, it still satisfies your sushi cravings without going out and spending 10 bucks. The udon is where it's at, strongly recommend getting all three fixings (tofu, seaweed and tempura). Support this gem, they provide quick service and delicious food for a very low price!
author: Neil A.

description: This place is awesome.  I got there at about 1:15, I bought a 1/2 order of Soba noodles and the California Rolls (which took 2 minutes with a several people ahead of me in line) all for around 5.50 or something and then I went to SW park and ate it on a bench in the afternoon sun.  Perfect quick lunch.
author: Aaron K.

description: My favorite lunch place when I'm at work.  I've become addicted to their soba.  So cheap, so filling and so good! And the couple who run the place are super sweet and very efficient, so don't worry if the line is long; it moves quickly.
author: Theodora R.

description: that was okay.  cheap.  standard sea weed salad, standard smoked salmon roll.
author: Lindsay T.

description: I love yoyo's!  The husband and wife team are super friendly (though they can be a bit militant if you stop coming in regularly).  And  although I did start to feel nauseous after eating the udon soup seven straight days in a row, they run a great, well-priced little sushi joint. yummy.
author: Anna S.

description:
mediocre at best. 
smells funny and last time i ate there i had hair in my food.
wouldn't go back unless it was far from payday and i was broke.
wah.
author: Karl H.

description: Great place!  Good tasty soups.  I've only tried the soba so far, but I'm sure the udon is good too.  It's a little salty, but all I needed to do is add a little hot water and it's fine!  The sushi's are not top notched, but hey for $2.50 what more can you ask for.  They are better and fresher than supermarkets'/Trader Joe's varieties and they much cheaper.  The service is quick and courteous.  I'm a fan of this place and definitely will come back every week.
author: TL C.

description:
food taste = 3
the taste of this japanese food is very average.

price / value = 4
for the amount you get, this place is quite decent.

service = 4.5
the lady and the guy are very friendly and nice.

environment = 4
no place to eat in, but everything looks like it would pass a health inspection.

misc = n/a

after reading so many good reviews, i may have had my expectations a bit too high.  i do not believe the owners are really japanese - which shouldn't matter as long as the food still tastes good.  perhaps i caught them at a bad time, but the food was just so-so.  but the amount and price are quite decent.
author: Bryce K.

description: $4.25 for udon plus tofu plus seaweed.  Good quality udon, not overcooked.  Soup base was flavorful as well.  One of my new favorite places near the triangle building.  I will try th chicken next time.  Yum Yum, a better value can not be had in FiDi.
author: M K.

description: Yum! As a fanatical bag luncher, I had never had an opportunity to go to Yo Yo's. For the past year or so, I've been playing go at lunch with a coworker every Wednesday. And for the past year I have drooled over his chicken teriyaki while I much on whatever I am eating that week. With my lunch forgotten today, I decided to hop in to Yo Yo's and see what all the fuss is about. I was able to get 9 veggie sushi, a seaweed salad, and daifuku for $5 even. That was easy! The sushi was good for veggie, the avocado obviously ripe and fresh, the cucumber was tasty, and the carrot was marinated in something tangy, probably rice vinegar. The seaweed salad was good, but tasted the same as every other seaweed salad I have ever had (and was a few dollars cheaper!). I got there probably around 12:15 and there was no line, so maybe I was just lucky. If you're looking for a quick, cheap, relatively tasty lunch, Yo Yo's is a safe bet. Maybe I'll forget my lunch more often...
author: Molly C.

description: what an interesting experience going my first time with a coworker.  we went at 1pm and the line was long (still?) out the door and kept getting longer.  it's like someone opened the back door to their kitchen.  it's cheeeeeap!... so you get what you pay for.  not a big selection which is good because you don't want one at a place like this.  they're efficient and the lady preparing the soup in the back is always a step ahead in the line.   certainly a grab your seaweed salad, california roll, and udon and go place!
author: Monk R.

description: I came here because of the great reviews claiming good food and cheap prices- something I badly need in this recession. However, when I went I was disappointed. The food tastes downright bad. As the reviews claim, it is cheap and the couple that run the joint are very nice but the product isn't even worth what you pay for it. I threw my food away without finishing half of it and now I am left hungry and sad as I was hoping to find a new gem. 2 stars for the cheap and nice factors. Taste is nothing better than 1 star.
author: sully b.

description: I was hoping to branch out of my everyday-the-same-lunch thing in downtown, and today I tried YO YO after reading some Yelp reviews.  Pretty good for under $5.  Really under $4.  Cheap and good sushi lunch, seaweed salad.  Fast, too.
author: B J.

description: mrs. yo recognizes me and tries to give me my usual, but i mix it up to keep her guessing. great take out... it's tasty, noncommittal, and cheap -- just like me on dates!
author: Erica C.
